episodes.natural_language:
Initial client contact on February 21, 2024, regarding a new workers’ compensation case for Christopher Wilkerson, associated with case Christopher-Wilkerson-WC-MVA-02-15-2024. The file indicates a WC case status and involves the Whaley Law Firm.

In the email thread, on February 21, 2024, at 4:21 PM, Aaron Whaley of Whaley Law Firm sent a message to Sarena Tuttle, Bryce Koon, and the Communication Project with the subject “new WC case,” stating, “Please add to FV and reach out.” The message included the firm’s standard signature with Aaron Whaley’s name, Whaley Law Firm, the firm’s Louisville address at 712 Lyndon Ln, Louisville, KY 40222, and phone number 502-583-4022. The recipients listed were Sarena Tuttle, Bryce Koon, and the Communication Project.

Approximately one minute later, at 4:22 PM, Bryce Koon replied from bryce@whaleylawfirm.com to Aaron Whaley, Sarena Tuttle, and the Communication Project, writing, “I will call him.” This exchange confirms an initial outreach plan for the new WC case involving Christopher Wilkerson and the intended contact with the client.

No one was CC’d on these messages. The case file is being managed by Whaley Law Firm, based in Louisville, Kentucky, as part of the firm’s Filevine/“FV” workflow. The “Communication Project” contact appears to be the Filevine app integration referenced in the messages.
episodes.author: Sarena Tuttle

In summary, the Whaley Law Firm notified Kentucky Farm Bureau Insurance of their letter of representation for the William Wilkerson claim and indicated ongoing receipt of workers’ compensation information, while also identifying Clearpath Mutual Insurance (Claim #238042) as the current coverage assigned to Debbie Smith, who can be contacted at 502-315-4280 or DSmith@HM1842.com. episodes.natural_language:
This case, identified as Christopher-Wilkerson-WC-MVA-02-15-2024, concerns client Christopher Wilkerson, with the file reference Christopher Wilkerson 238042. On March 7, 2024, at 10:13:34 a.m. Eastern Time, Sarena M. Tuttle, a litigation paralegal and workers’ compensation case manager at The Whaley Law Firm, sent an email regarding the matter. The message was addressed to Debbie Smith and carbon copied to Greg Whaley and Bryce Koon. The email originated from Sarena Tuttle at sarena@whaleylawfirm.com, and the subject line read: Re: Christopher Wilkerson 238042.

In the body of the email, Mrs. Tuttle thanked Mrs. Smith for the acknowledgment. She stated that once the requested questionnaire is returned, The Whaley Law Firm would forward all documents to Mrs. Smith. She noted that, at that time, the driver of the “Black KIA” had not been identified. She requested that Mrs. Smith advise whether the vehicle Mr. Wilkerson was driving was equipped with a dash cam or any other recording device. If such a device existed, she asked that recordings be preserved—whether video, audio, written, verbal, or other formats—and that a copy of all such recordings be forwarded to The Whaley Law Firm for review and investigation into the identity of the driver of the “Black KIA.” She concluded by offering to discuss the claim in further detail if anything else was needed and invited contact.

The message also included full sender and firm details: Sarena M. Tuttle, Litigation Paralegal and Workers’ Compensation Case Manager at The Whaley Law Firm, located at 712 Lyndon Lane, Louisville, KY 40222. Phone numbers listed were Direct: (502) 357-9971 and Office: (502) 583-4022 ext 104, with the email address Sarena@WhaleyLawFirm.com, and a note indicating “PLEASE NOTE NEW EMAIL ADDRESS.”

Earlier, on Wednesday, March 6, 2024, at 5:55?PM, Debbie Smith replied with a message to Ms. Tuttle stating: “Ms. Tuttle, Please find my acknowledgement letter of Mr. Whaley’s representation of Mr. Wilkerson. Once you have a chance to review the information and have any questions let me know. Thank you.” The closing line included the name “Debbie Smtih,” reflecting the sign-off in the note.

Bates inquired whether a time on Wednesday would work for all parties and provided her contact information: 110 Nancy Cox Drive, Campbellsville, KY 42718; PO Box 20400, Louisville, KY 40250-9802; Office phone 270-465-9771; Cell 270-799-4077; Fax 270-691-5750; kyfb.com.

Earlier that same morning, at around 11:19 AM, Sarena responded to Megan’s inquiry, saying she would check in with Mr. Wilkerson to determine what time would work best for him. Sarena noted that, as a truck driver, they obviously do not want to schedule this while he is driving.

Finally, at 11:28 AM on March 18, 2024, Sarena informed Megan that Mr. Wilkerson is available at 10:00 AM. In her signature, Sarena provided The Whaley Law Firm’s contact details: 712 Lyndon Lane, Louisville, KY 40222; direct line 502-357-9971; office line 502-583-4022 ext 104; email Sarena@WhaleyLawFirm.com, with a note to please use the new email address. The email chain demonstrates the ongoing coordination for Mr. Wilkerson’s recorded statement and the related PIP documentation.

Case: Christopher Wilkerson WC MVA matter (Christopher-Wilkerson-WC-MVA-02-15-2024). Client: Christopher Wilkerson. This note summarizes the email communications regarding Claim 04943051 for Christopher Wilkerson.

On March 14, 2024, Sarena M. Tuttle, a Litigation Paralegal and Workers’ Compensation Case Manager with The Whaley Law Firm, sent an email to Megan Bates of Kentucky Farm Bureau Insurance (Campbellsville Regional Office). In her message, she advised that the attached Mr. Wilkerson’s executed PIP Application was included and stated that the recorded statement needed to be rescheduled, asking Ms. Bates to provide a date and time that would work. Sarena’s signature block identified her role and contact information, including the firm’s address (712 Lyndon Lane, Louisville, KY 40222), direct line (D: 502-357-9971), office line (O: 502-583-4022 ext 104), and her email address (Sarena@WhaleyLawFirm.com), with a note indicating a new email address.

Later, on March 18, 2024, Megan Bates replied. She indicated that a time on Wednesday would work and provided her contact details for Kentucky Farm Bureau Insurance: Claim Adjuster II at the Campbellsville Regional Office, 110 Nancy Cox Drive, Campbellsville, KY 42718; mail to PO Box 20400, Louisville, KY 40250-9802; Office phone (270) 465-9771; Cell (270) 799-4077; Fax (270) 691-5750; kyfb.com with a member login. In the thread, Bates also reiterated the rescheduling objective for Mr. Wilkerson’s recorded statement.

There is a separate note in the thread from Sarena Tuttle, indicating that Mr. Wilkerson is a truck driver and that, given his driving schedule, they should avoid scheduling the recorded statement while he is on the road. In response to the scheduling inquiry, Bates wrote, “Would a time on Wednesday work for you all?” and provided further contact details in her prior message. The exchange shows a collaborative effort to arrange a suitable time for the recorded statement.

A later entry on March 18 shows Sarena confirming that Mr. Wilkerson was available at 10:00 a.m., and she again stressed the need to coordinate with Mr. Wilkerson’s schedule due to his trucking duties.

Finally, on March 20, 2024, at 10:14:37 a.m. (EDT), Sarena Tuttle sent an additional message to Megan Bates. She expressed appreciation for the discussion earlier that day and attached the scene photographs referenced during Mr. Wilkerson’s recorded statement. The message was signed by Sarena M. Tuttle as Litigation Paralegal & Workers’ Compensation Case Manager for The Whaley Law Firm, with the firm’s address, phone numbers, and her contact details included. The message also included a note to acknowledge the new email address: Sarena@WhaleyLawFirm.com.

She advised that the Employee’s Statement Questionnaire the recipient had requested was attached and offered that if anything else was needed, they should contact her directly to discuss the matter in further detail. The signature line identifies her as Sarena M. Tuttle, with the firm’s address at 712 Lyndon Lane, Louisville, KY 40222, and contact numbers D: (502) 357-9971, O: (502) 583-4022 ext 104, and email Sarena@WhaleyLawFirm.com, noting in parentheses “PLEASE NOTE NEW EMAIL ADDRESS.”

In the earlier part of the email chain, on March 7, 2024 at 10:13 AM, Sarena Tuttle wrote to Debbie Smith: Good morning Mrs. Smith, thank you for the acknowledgement. As soon as we receive the requested questionnaire back, we will forward all documents to you. At that time, the driver of the “Black KIA” has not been identified. We request that your insured advise whether the vehicle Mr. Wilkerson was driving was equipped with a dash cam or recording device of any kind. If so, we request that they preserve any recordings, whether video, audio, written, verbal, or otherwise, and forward a copy of any and all such recordings to our office for review and investigation into the identity of the Driver of the “Black KIA.” If you need anything else, please do not hesitate to contact us directly to discuss the claim in further detail. The message is signed with Tuttle’s identification and contact information, including the note “PLEASE NOTE NEW EMAIL ADDRESS.”

The March 7 message followed an earlier message from Debbie Smith on March 6, 2024 at 5:55 PM, in which she wrote: “Ms. Tuttle, Please find my acknowledgement letter of Mr. Whaley’s representation of Mr. Wilkerson. Once you have a chance to review the information and have any questions let me know. Thank you.” The message is signed “Debbie Smtih” (as provided in the record).

Overall, the record shows that, as of March 20, 2024, there had been no compensability decision received from Debbie’s office and no acknowledgement of the prior request regarding dash cam footage. The Whaley Law Firm attached the Employee’s Statement Questionnaire to the March 20 correspondence and reiterated the need for confirmation about dash cam or recording devices and for preserving and forwarding any relevant recordings if they exist. The new email address for Sarena Tuttle is noted in the signatures throughout the chain.

episodes.natural_language:
Case: Christopher-Wilkerson-WC-MVA-02-15-2024 centers on client Christopher Wilkerson and his workers’ compensation claim (Claim: 04943051). In late March 2024, The Whaley Law Firm’s personnel were coordinating with Kentucky Farm Bureau Insurance and corresponding parties regarding information requests, medical records, and scheduling related to Mr. Wilkerson’s case.

On March 28, 2024, Sarena Tuttle, a litigation paralegal and Workers’ Compensation Case Manager at The Whaley Law Firm, wrote to Shellie Cooper at Kentucky Farm Bureau Insurance with copies to Megan Bates, Greg Whaley, and Bryce Koon. She acknowledged receipt of the insurance carrier’s request for Mr. Wilkerson’s Workers’ Compensation information and for wage/salary verification along with his work status notes. She provided the Workers’ Compensation Carrier’s information and explained that wage/salary information had been requested from the WC Adjuster on March 5, 2024 and that a follow-up was sent on March 20, 2024; she had spoken with the adjuster that day and noted that the adjuster is requesting the information, and they are awaiting a response. She added that Mrs. Smith (the carrier) and their office are both awaiting medical records from Mr. Wilkerson’s providers and would forward them as soon as they are received. A list of Mr. Wilkerson’s current treating providers was included: Boyle County EMS, 18556 S. Danville Bypass, Danville, KY 40422 (fax 270-744-8642); Ephraim McDowell Regional Medical Center, 217 S. 3rd Street, Danville, KY 40422 (fax 859-239-6708); and Grant Chiropractic, 908 Russell Road, Columbia, KY 42728 (fax 270-384-2371). The email also carried Sarena’s contact details and noted her new email address (E: Sarena@WhaleyLawFirm.com).

The thread also shows prior communications. On March 20, 2024 at 10:14 AM (approximately), Sarena informed Megan Bates that scene photographs discussed during Mr. Wilkerson’s recorded statement were attached, referencing the attached photographs. Her signature block followed, again confirming her role and new email address.

Earlier, on March 18, 2024, Megan Bates replied with, “That works for me,” regarding scheduling. Bates is a Claim Adjuster II with Kentucky Farm Bureau Insurance, Campbellsville Regional Office, located at 110 Nancy Cox Drive, Campbellsville, KY 42718 (mailing address: PO Box 20400, Louisville, KY 40250-9802). Her office phone is 270-465-9771, cell 270-799-4077, fax 270-691-5750. The company website is kyfb.com with a member login.

In the March 18, 2024, message from Sarena (11:29 AM), she stated that Mr. Wilkerson is available at 10:00 AM. Earlier that same day (11:19 AM), she noted that she would check with Mr. Wilkerson to determine a suitable time and acknowledged the need to avoid scheduling while he is driving, as he is a truck driver. A follow-up message from Sarena at 11:04 AM on March 18, 2024, confirmed Megan’s question about a Wednesday time for the recording, including Megan’s contact details as listed above.

A prior March 14, 2024, 10:51 AM email from Sarena to Megan included Mr. Wilkerson’s executed PIP (Personal Injury Protection) Application. Sarena indicated that they understood the recorded statement needed to be rescheduled and asked Megan to provide a date and time that would work best.

The thread thus documents the ongoing coordination among The Whaley Law Firm, Kentucky Farm Bureau Insurance, and the involved parties to provide the requested information (including wage/salary verification and medical records), the listing of treating providers, the scheduling of Mr. Wilkerson’s recorded statement (with due consideration given to his truck-driving schedule), and the transmission of scene photographs from the recorded statement. The correspondence includes the carrier details, the adjuster’s name and claim number (Hartford Mutual Insurance, formerly Clearpath; Adjuster: Debbie Smith; Claim: 238042), and the contact information for all involved parties, along with the notice of a new email address for Sarena Tuttle.

__CLIENT CONTACT__
__Details:__ Recvd Call from Client - Great timing on his part - Advised PIP is up & ready to go - Simply awaiting AWW/TTD Info from WC Adj - Advised WC Adj is dragging her feet a bit but is requesting AWW Info & MRs as of today - Advised should have an answer on lost wages hopefully by end of next week - Client asked about compensation rates - Advised Too early to tell - Discuss how BI & WC Settlements are figured and reaffirmed since we do not have any info on the Black Kia we do not have a BI claim to pursue - Moving forward with WC only - Client expressed understanding & appreciated the information - Client is going back to chiro this Saturday - Asked Client about OWN - Client states he does not remember being placed 'off work' - he was immediately terminated so OWN was not necessary - He also advised Employer forced him to sign resignation document before he could pick up last paycheck - Client has filed for Unemployment but expects denial due to resignation document - Client is prepared to file appeal & advising UI about forced signature - Client very pleasant & will keep us updated on Tx Progress 
__Person Making Contact:__ Sarena
__Date & Time__: March 28 2024
episodes.natural_language:
Initial client contact on March 28, 2024, with Sarena regarding Christopher Wilkerson’s WC-MVA case (Christopher-Wilkerson-WC-MVA-02-15-2024). The client described the timing as great and advised that PIP is up and ready to go, with us simply awaiting AWW/TTD information from the workers’ compensation adjuster. He noted that the adjuster is dragging her feet a bit but is requesting AWW information and MRs as of today, and he expects to have an answer on lost wages hopefully by the end of next week. The client asked about compensation rates, and he was advised that it is too early to tell. We discussed how BI and WC settlements are figured and reaffirmed that, since we do not have any information on the Black Kia, there is no BI claim to pursue, so we will move forward with WC only. The client expressed understanding and appreciation for the information, and he said he would be going back to the chiropractor this Saturday.

Regarding OWN, the client stated he does not remember being placed “off work” and that he was terminated immediately, so OWN was not necessary. He also advised that the employer forced him to sign a resignation document before he could pick up his last paycheck. He has filed for unemployment but expects denial due to the resignation document, and he is prepared to file an appeal and to advise UI about the forced signature. The client was very pleasant and will keep us updated on Tx Progress.

Case: Christopher-Wilkerson-WC-MVA-02-15-2024. Client: Christopher Wilkerson. This matter concerns Christopher Wilkerson, with the file referenced as Christopher Wilkerson 238042.

On April 5, 2024, Debbie Smith, Senior Claims Examiner for Harford Mutual Insurance Group, sent a message to Sarena Tuttle confirming that ClearPath has accepted the claim as compensable. Debbie noted, however, that she had no medical records to verify any off-work status and that she had requested medical records from Ephraim McDowell, Grant Chiropractic, and Adair Family Medical. She indicated that she still needed a copy of the medical authorization and Form 113 to confirm the designated physician. Debbie asked that any medical records be forwarded for her review and added that she had confirmed with the employer that they do not have a copy of dash cam footage of the accident. The message included a note about a merger: due to the completed merger with Harford Mutual Insurance Group, all @clearpathmutual.com addresses have changed to the @hm1842.com extension, and urged updating contact lists for efficient handling of correspondence. Debbie signed as Sr. Claims Examiner and provided her contact information, and the message carried the usual confidentiality and misaddress disclaimers typical of such communications.

In the prior correspondence, on March 6, 2024, Debbie Smith acknowledged Mr. Whaley’s representation of Mr. Wilkerson, stating that once the reviewing of the information is completed and any questions arise, she would be in touch. The next day, March 7, 2024, Sarena M. Tuttle of The Whaley Law Firm replied, noting that they had not yet received a compensability decision from Debbie’s office, nor had they received acknowledgment of the firm’s prior request to confirm whether the incident involved any dash cam footage. Sarena informed Debbie that the Employee's Statement Questionnaire had been attached as requested and invited further discussion if more information was needed. She included her contact details and reminded that her email address was the newly updated one.

Earlier, on March 7, 2024, Sarena’s message also conveyed that, at that time, the driver of the “Black KIA” had not been identified, and requested the insured to advise whether the vehicle driven by Mr. Wilkerson was equipped with a dash cam or any recording device. If such a device existed, they asked that recordings—whether video, audio, written, verbal, or otherwise—be preserved and forwarded to their office for review and to aid in the investigation of the driver of the Black KIA.

Then, on March 6, 2024, Debbie Smith had written to acknowledge Mr. Whaley’s representation, indicating that upon review of the information and any questions arising, she would reach out. The March 20, 2024 communication from Sarena reiterates that no compensability decision had yet been provided and notes again the need for confirmation regarding dash cam footage; it also confirms that the Employee's Statement Questionnaire was sent as requested and reiterates that the firm is available to discuss the matter further.

Additionally, the thread contains standard email footers reflecting a recent merger and the associated changes of domain, and includes confidentiality notices typical of such communications. It also contains a cautionary note within one message about an external email and an automatic notice indicating the email’s origin outside the organization.

In summary, after an initial representation acknowledgment, the parties discussed dash cam footage and the identity of the vehicle driver, with the Whaley firm supplying the Employee's Statement Questionnaire. By early April 2024, ClearPath/ClearPath-mutual records indicated the claim was accepted as compensable, but medical records to establish off-work status were still outstanding, with Debbie Smith requesting medical records from specified providers and copies of the medical authorization and Form 113 to confirm the designated physician, while also confirming the absence of dash cam footage in the employer’s records.

episodes.natural_language:
Case: Christopher-Wilkerson-WC-MVA-02-15-2024. Client: Christopher Wilkerson. In early April 2024, communications between The Whaley Law Firm and ClearPath/Harford Mutual Insurance Group concerned the workers’ compensation claim for Christopher Wilkerson, arising from the motor vehicle incident on February 15, 2024. The Whaley Law Firm’s Sarena Tuttle, a litigation paralegal and Workers’ Compensation Case Manager, advised Debbie Smith that the executed Form 106 and Form 113 were attached and noted that Chris Wilkerson is still treating with Dr. Anthony Grant at Grant Chiropractic Center in Columbia, Kentucky. The firm also stated that they had requested all medical records to date and were awaiting receipt, and that those records would be forwarded to Debbie as soon as they began arriving.

On April 5, 2024, Debbie Smith replied to acknowledge that ClearPath had accepted the claim as compensable. She stated, however, that she had no medical records to verify any off-work status and that she had requested medical information from Ephraim McDowell, Grant Chiropractic, and Adair Family Medical. Debbie indicated she still needed a copy of the medical authorization and Form 113 to confirm the designated physician. She asked that any available medical records be forwarded for her review and noted that the employer had confirmed they do not possess a copy of dash cam footage of the accident. Debbie also reminded recipients of the merger between Harford Mutual Insurance Group and ClearPath Mutual Insurance Group, after which all @clearpathmutual.com email addresses had changed to the @hm1842.com extension, and she requested recipients update their contact lists accordingly. Her contact details were provided: Sr. Claims Examiner, Harford Mutual Insurance Group, Phone: 502-315-4280; Main: 800-638-3669.

The communications prior to April 5, 2024 tracked a different point in the ongoing exchange. On March 20, 2024, Sarena Tuttle informed Debbie Smith that they had not yet received a compensability decision from Debbie’s office, nor an acknowledgement of their earlier request for confirmation from Christopher Wilkerson’s client regarding whether dash cam footage existed. She attached the Employee’s Statement Questionnaire and invited Debbie to request anything else needed to discuss the matter further. Sarena’s message included her contact information and noted the new email address associated with The Whaley Law Firm.

Earlier still, on March 7, 2024, Sarena wrote to Debbie: good morning, and thanks for the acknowledgement. She stated that once the requested questionnaire was returned, they would forward all documents to Debbie. At that time, the driver of the “Black KIA” had not been identified. Sarena requested that Debbie’s insured advise whether the vehicle Mr. Wilkerson was driving was equipped with a dash cam or any recording device, and that any such recordings be preserved and forwarded to the Whaley Law Firm for review and investigation into the identity of the driver of the Black KIA.

 Debbie Smith had previously acknowledged representation on March 6, 2024, stating that she had received the acknowledgement letter of Mr. Whaley’s representation of Mr. Wilkerson, and inviting any questions once the information had been reviewed.

The communications reflect the ongoing efforts to assemble and review records, confirm compensability, determine the existence and preservation of dash cam footage, and confirm the designated physician. The correspondence also includes multiple confirmations of representation, notices about email domain changes following the merger, and standard confidentiality and error-handling notices embedded in the emails.

episodes.natural_language:
Case: Christopher-Wilkerson-WC-MVA-02-15-2024
Client: Christopher Wilkerson

In early 2024, the Christopher Wilkerson case (WC MVA, file 238042) unfolded as a communications exchange between The Whaley Law Firm and Harford Mutual Insurance Group (formerly ClearPath Mutual). The sequence begins with Debbie Smith, a Senior Claims Examiner for Harford Mutual, acknowledging the Whaley Law Firm’s representation of Mr. Wilkerson. In an email dated March 6, 2024, she stated, “Please find my acknowledgement letter of Mr. Whaley’s representation of Mr. Wilkerson,” and noted the merger with Harford Mutual that had changed all @clearpathmutual.com addresses to @hm1842.com, advising the recipient to update their contact list. Debbie signed with her contact information and included confidentiality language typical of the communications.

The following day, March 7, 2024, Sarena Tuttle of The Whaley Law Firm replied to Debbie’s acknowledgement. She expressed appreciation for the acknowledgement and indicated that once the Whaley firm received the requested questionnaire, they would forward all documents to Harford Mutual. She also noted that the driver of the Black KIA involved in the incident had not yet been identified and asked Debbie’s insured to confirm whether the vehicle operated by Mr. Wilkerson was equipped with a dash cam or any recording device. If such a device existed, the Whaley firm requested preservation of all recordings and that copies be forwarded to their office for review and to aid in identifying the driver of the Black KIA. The message included Sarena’s contact details and reminded recipients of the new email address.

On March 20, 2024, the thread continued with another communication from The Whaley Law Firm. Sarena Tuttle wrote that, to date, they had not received a compensability decision from Harford Mutual nor an acknowledgment of their earlier request regarding dash cam footage. She attached the Employee’s Statement Questionnaire as requested and invited Debbie to contact them if anything else was needed. The email reiterated the ongoing contact information for Sarena and again included the new email address.

Further correspondence followed on March 7 and March 20 that focused on the status of the investigation and the documentation needed. By March 20, the Whaley firm had provided the Employee’s Statement Questionnaire, and they reminded Harford Mutual to communicate any additional requirements so that the matter could proceed.

On April 5, 2024, the timeline shows two significant contributions from Debbie Smith and The Whaley Law Firm. At 9:29 AM, Debbie wrote to Sarena confirming that ClearPath had accepted the claim as compensable. She noted that she did not yet have medical records to verify any off-work status and that she had requested medical records from Ephraim McDowell, Grant Chiropractic, and Adair Family Medical. Debbie also requested a copy of the medical authorization and Form 113 to confirm the designated physician and asked that any available medical records be forwarded for her review. She added that she had confirmed with the employer that they did not possess any dash cam footage of the accident. Debbie closed with thanks.

Shortly thereafter, at 9:46 AM, Sarena responded with a message confirming that the claim remained compensable. She attached the executed Form 106 and Form 113 and provided details about Mr. Wilkerson’s current treatment: he was still seeing Dr. Anthony Grant at Grant Chiropractic Center in Columbia, Kentucky. She stated that all available medical records had been requested and were being sought, and she would forward them to Debbie as they were received. Sarena noted that the firm had already requested all medical records to date and would forward them when obtained. She also reaffirmed the new Harford Mutual contact information and included the standard confidentiality and external-origin notices found in the correspondence.

Throughout the April 5 exchanges, the notices regarding the merger remained prominent, reminding recipients that all @clearpathmutual.com addresses had been migrated to the @hm1842.com extension, and encouraging updating of contact lists for efficient handling. The emails also contained the customary confidential-use notices and warnings about handling confidential information and about false or fraudulent claims.

Key facts preserved from the correspondence:
- Case: Christopher Wilkerson, WC MVA case, file reference Christopher-Wilkerson-WC-MVA-02-15-2024; Client: Christopher Wilkerson; Claim number or internal reference 238042.
- Parties involved: The Whaley Law Firm (Sarena M. Tuttle, Litigation Paralegal & Workers’ Compensation Case Manager) and Harford Mutual Insurance Group (formerly ClearPath Mutual) via Debbie Smith (Senior Claims Examiner) and other Harford Mutual communications staff.
- Timeline of material communications: 
  - March 6, 2024: Debbie Smith acknowledges Whaley’s representation (merger-related email domain change noted).
  - March 7, 2024: Sarena Tuttle requests the dash cam/recording-device information and preservation of any recordings; driver of Black KIA not identified.
  - March 20, 2024: Sarena notes no compensability decision received and attaches Employee’s Statement Questionnaire; reiterates request regarding dash cam footage.
  - March 20, 2024: (Earlier in the thread) The Whaley firm sent the Employee’s Statement Questionnaire; continued to pursue information.
  - April 5, 2024: Debbie confirms that ClearPath has accepted the claim as compensable; medical-records status pending; requests medical records from Ephraim McDowell, Grant Chiropractic, and Adair Family Medical; requests medical authorization and Form 113 to confirm the designated physician; confirms no dash cam footage is in the employer’s possession.
  - April 5, 2024: Sarena confirms compensable status and forwards Form 106 and Form 113 as executed; notes ongoing treatment with Dr. Anthony Grant at Grant Chiropractic Center; states that medical records have been requested and will be forwarded as they are received.
- Medical treatment and records: At the time of the April 5 communications, Chris Wilkerson was actively treated by Dr. Anthony Grant at Grant Chiropractic Center in Columbia, KY. The requesting party sought medical records from Ephraim McDowell, Grant Chiropractic, and Adair Family Medical, along with a medical authorization and Form 113 to identify the designated physician.
- Dash cam/records: Attempts were made to locate dash cam footage from the incident; the employer stated they did not have a copy of any dash cam footage.
- Documentation shared: Form 106 and Form 113 (executed) were attached in the April 5, 2024 reply from The Whaley Law Firm; an Employee’s Statement Questionnaire had been provided earlier by the Whaley Firm; copies of these documents were exchanged as part of the case administration.
- Contact and confidentiality notes: The emails reference the merger–driven domain change to @hm1842.com; there are standard confidentiality notices and cautions about external emails and the illegality of false claims.

In sum, by early April 2024 the claim was accepted as compensable, Mr. Wilkerson remained under treatment with Grant Chiropractic Center, and the parties were actively pursuing medical records, medical authorization, and confirmation of the designated physician, with Form 106 and Form 113 executed and exchanged. The communications also reflect the ongoing efforts to obtain dash cam footage and to identify the driver of the other vehicle, the Black KIA, involved in the incident.

episodes.original_body:
Case: Christopher-Wilkerson-WC-MVA-02-15-2024
Client: Christopher Wilkerson

__CLIENT CONTACT__
__Details:__ Recvd Client VMs while out - Returned Client Call - Discuss the fact he may have a possible Wrongful Termination Claim - States he was fired after just 1 accident while another employee, Jonathan Vaughn is still employed after 3 accidents - Also States that Nathan Bennett is not properly Registered w/Safety Clearinghouse & does not drug test their employees prior to putting them behind the wheel - Advised Client that I would update AW/BK on this for consideration of a WFT Suit - Advised Client KY is an 'at will' state which allows employers to terminate with little or no reason, making WFT claims difficult - Client Expressed understanding

Spoke with Client about Tx Status - Dr. Grant is thinking he may have to refer Client out to another provider but did not elaborate - Client states he is still having pain in his hip & ribs almost 90 days post accident - Discussed the possibility of a tear or pinched nerve in hip - Advised Client to discuss w/Dr. Grant further and see if he is wanting to request additional imaging - Client expressed understanding and will discuss at next appt 05.11

Also discuss how WC Claims are valued and that it is impossible to even begin discussing numbers due to Impairment weight in formula - Client expressed understanding and appreciated us taking time to explain the process - He will call us with an update after his appt Saturday 05.11 
__Person Making Contact:__ Sarena
__Date & Time__: May 09 2024
episodes.natural_language:
Case: Christopher-Wilkerson-WC-MVA-02-15-2024. Client: Christopher Wilkerson.

Initial client contact on May 9, 2024, by Sarena regarding Christopher Wilkerson’s motor vehicle accident on February 15, 2024 and a possible wrongful termination claim. The client reported that he was fired after just one accident, while another employee, Jonathan Vaughn, remains employed after three accidents. He also stated that Nathan Bennett is not properly registered with Safety Clearinghouse and does not drug test their employees prior to putting them behind the wheel. I advised that I would update AW/BK on this for consideration of a wrongful termination (WFT) suit, and I explained that Kentucky is an at-will state, which allows employers to terminate with little or no reason, making WFT claims difficult. The client expressed understanding.

We also spoke about treatment status. Dr. Grant is thinking he may refer the client to another provider, but did not elaborate. The client states he is still experiencing pain in his hip and ribs nearly 90 days post-accident. We discussed the possibility of a tear or a pinched nerve in the hip and advised the client to discuss this with Dr. Grant further and to see if additional imaging should be requested. The client expressed understanding and will discuss at his next appointment on May 11.

Additionally, we discussed how workers’ compensation claims are valued and that it is impossible to begin discussing dollar amounts due to impairment weight in the formula. The client expressed understanding and appreciated the time taken to explain the process. He will call us with an update after his appointment on Saturday, May 11.

episodes.natural_language:
Case: Christopher-Wilkerson-WC-MVA-02-15-2024. Client: Christopher Wilkerson. The Whaley Law Firm represents Christopher Wilkerson in a workers’ compensation motor vehicle accident matter.

On July 24, 2024, Sarena M. Tuttle, a litigation paralegal and workers’ compensation case manager for The Whaley Law Firm, wrote to Debbie Smith of Harford Mutual/ClearPath to provide an update on Mr. Wilkerson’s treatment. She reported that Mr. Wilkerson was unhappy with the treatment he received at Grant Chiropractic, and that Dr. Grant advised him that, having exhausted his initial 20 visits, his claim had ended. Mr. Wilkerson had arranged a new appointment with Taylor Co. Chiropractic & Rehabilitation on Greenbriar Drive in Campbellsville, Kentucky for July 29, 2024. An updated KY DWC Form 113 for Taylor Co. Chiropractic was attached. Ms. Tuttle also invited Debi to contact her directly if there were any questions. The Whaley Law Firm contact details listed included: 712 Lyndon Lane, Louisville, KY 40222; D: (502) 357-9971; O: (502) 583-4022 ext 104; E: Sarena@WhaleyLawFirm.com, with a note to “PLEASE NOTE NEW EMAIL ADDRESS.”

Earlier communications in the thread reflect ongoing administration of the claim and related medical records and evidence. On April 5, 2024, Debbie Smith noted the merger of ClearPath with Harford Mutual Insurance Group, explaining that all clearpathmutual.com email addresses had changed to the hm1842.com extension and requesting that contact lists be updated to ensure efficient handling of correspondence. In that message, Debbie stated that ClearPath had accepted the claim as compensable, but there were no medical records to verify any off-work status; she had requested medical records from Ephraim McDowell, Grant Chiropractic, and Adair Family Medical, and she still needed a copy of the medical authorization and Form 113 to confirm the designated physician. Debbie asked that any medical records be forwarded for her review.

That same day, April 5, 2024, at 9:46 a.m., Sarena Tuttle replied with the executed Form 106 and Form 113 attached and noted that Mr. Wilkerson was still treating with Dr. Anthony Grant at Grant Chiropractic Center in Columbia, Kentucky. The Whaley Law Firm had requested all medical records to date and was awaiting receipt; once records were received, they would be forwarded to Debbie Smith. The message included Sarena Tuttle’s contact information and repeated the new email address notice.

Earlier in the process, on April 5, 2024 at 9:29 a.m., Debbie Smith confirmed that ClearPath had accepted the claim as compensable but again emphasized that there were no medical records to verify off-work status and reiterated the need for medical records from specific providers and for a medical authorization and Form 113 to confirm the designated physician. She also confirmed that she had requested medical records for review and noted that the employer did not have dash cam footage of the accident.

On March 20, 2024, Sarena Tuttle sent Debbie Smith a message noting that, to date, the Whaley Law Firm had not received a compensability decision from Debbie’s office, nor an acknowledgement of their prior email requesting confirmation about dash cam footage for the incident. The message stated that the Employee’s Statement Questionnaire was attached and ready for return, and that if Debbie needed anything else, she should contact them directly to discuss the matter.

On March 7, 2024, Sarena Tuttle wrote to Debbie Smith in good morning form, thanking her for the acknowledgment and indicating that once the requested questionnaire was returned, all documents would be forwarded. At that time, the driver of the “Black KIA” had not been identified. The Whaley Law Firm requested that Debbie’s insured inform whether the vehicle Mr. Wilkerson was driving was equipped with any dash cam or recording device, and if so, that any recordings—video, audio, written, verbal, or otherwise—be preserved and forwarded as relevant.

The communications reflect a continuing process to confirm compensability, gather medical records and designations, and manage Mr. Wilkerson’s ongoing medical treatment as part of the workers’ compensation matter arising from the MVA on February 15, 2024, with the case caption and client details noted at the top. The thread also documents the administrative transition caused by Harford Mutual’s merger, including the new hm1842.com email addresses and the accompanying confidentiality and disclosure notices embedded in the messages.

Case: Christopher-Wilkerson-WC-MVA-02-15-2024
Client: Christopher Wilkerson

__CLIENT CONTACT__
__Details:__ Recvd Call from Client - He is starting to get into a financial situation due to being terminated from his WC Employer & his subsequent Employer - His WC Employer terminated him due to MVA - Subsequent Employer terminated him due to missing work for PT Appts - Advised Client that we will reach out to adjuster to see about getting TTD initiated - Explained to Client that this is not a guarantee they WC Adj will be co-operative but we can try - Also explained that while WC will only pay TTD (2/3 AWW), we can get additional 1/3 from PIP - Client expressed understanding - Advised Client that if WC is not willing to initiate TTD then we will look into getting him with a provider that has weekend appts available - He again expressed understanding & looks forward to hearing back from us asap 
__Person Making Contact:__ Sarena
__Date & Time__: August 12 2024
episodes.natural_language: Initial client contact on August 12, 2024 with Christopher Wilkerson regarding a workers’ compensation matter stemming from a motor vehicle accident. He reported that he is experiencing a financial downturn after being terminated by his workers’ compensation employer due to the MVA, and subsequently terminated by his next employer for missing work to attend physical therapy appointments. We advised that we would reach out to the adjuster to initiate temporary total disability (TTD) and explained that this is not a guarantee of the adjuster’s cooperation, but we would attempt. We also explained that while workers’ compensation pays TTD at two-thirds of the average weekly wage (AWW), an additional one-third could potentially be obtained from PIP. The client expressed understanding. We noted that if the WC does not initiate TTD, we would explore getting him with a provider who has weekend appointment availability. He again expressed understanding and stated that he looks forward to hearing back from us as soon as possible. The contact was made by Sarena.

episodes.natural_language:
Case: Christopher-Wilkerson-WC-MVA-02-15-2024. Client: Christopher Wilkerson.

This narrative covers the communications regarding Christopher Wilkerson’s workers’ compensation claim (Claim No. 238042) as handled by The Whaley Law Firm and the claims administrator, Harford Mutual Insurance Group (domain hm1842.com), from March 2024 through August 2024. The Whaley Law Firm represented Mr. Wilkerson in the matter, with Sarena M. Tuttle serving as Litigation Paralegal and Workers’ Compensation Case Manager. The firm’s contact details were: 712 Lyndon Lane, Louisville, KY 40222; direct line 502-357-9971; office line 502-583-4022 ext 104; email Sarena@WhaleyLawFirm.com (noting the address change to the new domain).

On March 20, 2024, Sarena Tuttle sent a message to Debbie Smith indicating that, to date, they had not received a compensability decision from Harford Mutual nor an acknowledgement of their prior email requesting confirmation from Mr. Wilkerson about whether there was dash cam footage of the incident. She attached the Employee’s Statement Questionnaire and invited Debbie to contact them directly if anything else was needed.

In early April 2024, the communications continued as follows: Debbie Smith responded on April 5, 2024, confirming that ClearPath had accepted the claim as compensable, but noting that there were no medical records to verify any off-work status. Debbie stated that medical records were being requested from Ephraim McDowell, Grant Chiropractic, and Adair Family Medical, and that a copy of the medical authorization and KY DWC Form 113 was needed to confirm the designated physician. She asked that any medical records be forwarded for review and noted that the employer did not have dash cam footage of the accident. In the same thread, Debbie’s message included a reminder about the merger that had changed all @clearpathmutual.com addresses to the @hm1842.com extension and urged updating contact lists accordingly. Earlier in the day, Sarena had informed Debbie that Form 106 and Form 113 had been executed, and that Chris was still receiving treatment with Dr. Anthony Grant at Grant Chiropractic Center in Columbia, KY. They were awaiting receipt of medical records to date and planned to forward them as soon as they were received.

Throughout April 2024, the exchange continued with regard to medical records and treating providers. Debe’s notes reiterate the need for medical records and the Form 113 to confirm the designated physician; the team also confirmed that they were seeking medical records from Ephraim McDowell, Grant Chiropractic, and Adair Family Medical, and they requested any available records be forwarded for review. There is also mention of continued discussion about whether dash cam footage existed, with the employer specifically stating they did not have any dash cam footage of the accident.

On July 24, 2024, Sarena Tuttle provided an updated status. She advised Debbie that Mr. Wilkerson was unhappy with the treatment at Grant Chiropractic and that Dr. Grant had told him that after exhausting his initial 20 visits, his claim had ended. Mr. Wilkerson had scheduled an appointment with Taylor Co. Chiropractic & Rehabilitation on Greenbriar Drive in Campbellsville, KY for July 29, 2024. The message noted the attachment of an updated KY DWC Form 113 for Taylor Co. Chiropractic & Rehabilitation and invited any questions or further discussion.

Finally, on August 12, 2024, Sarena Tuttle sent another update. She reported that Mr. Wilkerson had called that morning to say he had been terminated from his job due to his medical treatment and ongoing appointments. The Whaley Law Firm requested the initiation of his temporary total disability (TTD) benefits and asked Debbie Smith to contact them if there were any questions or issues with the request.

In sum, the record reflects a series of communications between The Whaley Law Firm and Harford Mutual (HM) regarding Christopher Wilkerson’s workers’ compensation claim, covering March through August 2024. Key elements include ongoing medical treatment with Grant Chiropractic (and later Taylor Co. Chiropractic & Rehabilitation), a claim acceptance as compensable, the need for medical records and Form 113 to designate the physician, dash cam footage status, and finally the request to commence TTD benefits after Mr. Wilkerson reported termination from employment due to medical treatment. Attachments mentioned in the exchanges include the executed Form 106 and Form 113 (as of April 5, 2024) and an updated KY DWC Form 113 for Taylor Co. Chiropractic (as of July 24, 2024).

episodes.natural_language:
The case Christopher-Wilkerson-WC-MVA-02-15-2024 involves client Christopher Wilkerson. The communications center on April 2024, when Debbie Smith, Sr. Claims Examiner for ClearPath Specialty Insurance (later referred to after the merger as Harford Mutual Insurance Group, with email addresses transitioning to the hm1842.com domain), advised The Whaley Law Firm that ClearPath had accepted the claim as compensable but that there were no medical records yet to verify any off-work status. Debbie noted that she had requested medical records from Ephraim McDowell, Grant Chiropractic, and Adair Family Medical, and she needed a copy of the medical authorization and the KY Department of Workers’ Claims Form 113 to confirm the designated physician. She also asked that any medical records be forwarded for review and added that the employer did not have a copy of dash cam footage of the accident. She supplied her direct and main contact numbers and included confidential‑communication notices customary for the insurer.

Shortly after, on the same thread, Sarena M. Tuttle, a Litigation Paralegal and Workers’ Compensation Case Manager for The Whaley Law Firm, responded on April 5, 2024. She advised that she was attaching the executed Form 106 and Form 113, and she stated that Mr. Wilkerson was still currently treating with Dr. Anthony Grant at Grant Chiropractic Center in Columbia, Kentucky. She noted that they had requested all medical records to date and were awaiting receipt of those records, and that once they began receiving them, they would forward them to Debbie for review.

Also on April 5, 2024, Debbie’s message confirmed that ClearPath had accepted the claim as compensable but reiterated the lack of medical records to verify off-work status and the need for medical authorizations and Form 113. She indicated she had requested records from Ephraim McDowell, Grant Chiropractic, and Adair Family Medical, and she again asked for a copy of the medical authorization and Form 113 to confirm the designated physician, adding that if any medical records were available, they should be forwarded. Debbie also confirmed with The Whaley Law Firm that the employer did not possess dash cam footage of the accident. In the same thread, Debbie reminded that, due to the merger with Harford Mutual Insurance Group, all ClearPath email addresses had transitioned to the hm1842.com extension.

Earlier in the thread, on April 5, 2024 (with timestamps in the exchanged emails), Sarena had also sent a separate note to Debbie noting that Chris was still treating with Dr. Grant and that Form 106 and Form 113 had been attached. She stated that they had requested all medical records to date and would forward them as soon as they were received.

By July 24, 2024, the communications indicate a shift in Mr. Wilkerson’s treatment experience. In an email from Sarena, she reported that Mr. Wilkerson was not happy with the treatment at Grant Chiropractic, and Dr. Grant advised that since Mr. Wilkerson had exhausted his initial 20 visits, the claim had ended. Mr. Wilkerson had made an appointment with Taylor Co. Chiropractic & Rehabilitation on Greenbriar Drive in Campbellsville, Kentucky for July 29, 2024. The email also notes that the updated Kentucky DWC Form 113 for Taylor Co. Chiropractic & Rehabilitation was attached, and Sarena invited Debbie to contact them directly if there were questions for further discussion.

On August 12, 2024 at 1:38 PM, Sarena notified Debbie that Mr. Wilkerson had been terminated from his job due to his medical treatment and ongoing appointments, and she requested initiation of his Temporary Total Disability (TTD) benefits, asking The Whaley Law Firm to contact their office if there were any questions or issues regarding the request.

By August 23, 2024, the thread shows ongoing concerns about therapy approval. At 2:23 PM, Sarena wrote that Mr. Wilkerson had contacted them again, advising that his physical therapy had not yet been approved. She asked Debbie to update them on what was required to obtain approval for his physical therapy and indicated that they were awaiting medical records for his TTD benefits.

That same day, at 9:16 PM, Debbie replied to Sarena. She stated that she had faxed approval for 12 therapy visits and requested updated notes for off-work status so she could review the file for lost time. Debbie closed with thanks and included the standard confidentiality and privacy disclaimers associated with her communications.

Throughout these exchanges, the correspondence also carried standard headers and notices. The messages emphasized confidentiality and the restricted distribution of attachments, reminded recipients that the communications were intended solely for the named addressees, and advised that the merger had caused the @clearpathmutual.com addresses to become @hm1842.com addresses. The Whaley Law Firm’s contact details and Dr. Grant’s and Taylor Co. Chiropractic’s involvement were repeatedly referenced, along with status updates on medical records, Form 106, Form 113, and the designation of the physician, as well as the ongoing issue of off-work status and lost-time review.

__CLIENT CONTACT__
__Details:__ Update to Client:
Good morning Chris,
We do apologize for the delayed response. Your adjuster was out of the office the end of last week. However, she has updated us this morning that she has approved 12 additional visits with Taylor Co. Chiro. Please keep us posted with how treatment is progressing and be sure to update us if Taylor Co. sends you out for any imaging. We are still awaiting your updated medical records from them as well. As soon as they are received we can get them over to your adjuster in support of your TTD Application. -Sarena, The Whaley Law Firm

episodes.natural_language:
Case: Christopher Wilkerson, WC-MVA-02-15-2024. Client: Christopher Wilkerson. This matter concerns a workers’ compensation claim (Christopher Wilkerson, 238042) arising from a motor vehicle accident on February 15, 2024. The Whaley Law Firm represents Mr. Wilkerson, with Sarena M. Tuttle serving as the litigation paralegal and workers’ compensation case manager. The correspondence in this file involves Debbie Smith, a Senior Claims Examiner for ClearPath Specialty Insurance, later operating under Harford Mutual Insurance Group after a merger, and members of the Whaley team including Greg Whaley and Bryce Koon. The case file contains multiple communications spanning April through August 2024.

On April 5, 2024, Debbie Smith advised that ClearPath had accepted the claim as compensable, but there were no medical records to verify any off-work status, and she indicated that those records had been requested. Later that same day, Sarena Tuttle responded with attachments: the executed Form 106 and Form 113. She noted that Mr. Wilkerson was still receiving treatment with Dr. Anthony Grant at Grant Chiropractic Center in Columbia, Kentucky, and that all medical records to date had been requested and were awaited; as soon as records began arriving, they would be forwarded.

The thread continued with additional updates over the ensuing months. On July 24, 2024, Sarena reported that Mr. Wilkerson was not happy with the treatment at Grant Chiropractic, and that Dr. Grant had advised that since Mr. Wilkerson had exhausted his initial 20 visit allowance, his claim had ended. Mr. Wilkerson subsequently scheduled an appointment with Taylor Co. Chiropractic & Rehabilitation on Greenbriar Drive in Campbellsville, Kentucky for July 29, 2024. An updated KY Division of Workers’ Compensation Form 113 for Taylor Co. Chiropractic was attached.

By August 12, 2024, Sarena informed Debbie that Mr. Wilkerson had called to report he had been terminated from his position due to his medical treatment and ongoing appointments, and that initiation of his Temporary Total Disability (TTD) benefits was requested.

On August 23, 2024, Debbie indicated that she had faxed approval for 12 therapy visits and requested updated notes on the off-work status so she could review the file for lost time. Later that day, at 2:23 PM, Sarena responded that Mr. Wilkerson had again contacted them, stating that his physical therapy had not yet been approved and asking what was needed to obtain PT approval; she also noted that they were awaiting medical records for TTD benefits.

That same day, Debbie reiterated the status of the PT approval by stating that 12 therapy visits had been approved by the insurer. The thread included standard reminders about confidentiality and the external origin of some emails, and also contained the insurer’s new contact information following the merger with Harford Mutual Insurance Group: Debbie’s message reminded that, due to the merger, all ClearPath email addresses had changed to the hm1842.com domain. In the Whaley firm signature blocks, Sarena noted the new email address and included her contact details: The Whaley Law Firm, 712 Lyndon Lane, Louisville, KY 40222; direct line (502) 357-9971; office line (502) 583-4022 ext 104; email Sarena@WhaleyLawFirm.com, with a note to “PLEASE NOTE NEW EMAIL ADDRESS.”

On August 26, 2024, Sarena sent a brief closing note: “Good morning Debbie, That is awesome. Thank you so much.” Her message was followed by the standard firm signature block, including a reminder of her new email address.

Throughout these communications, the case remained identified as Christopher Wilkerson, 238042, with the overarching matter being a workers’ compensation claim associated with a motor vehicle incident dated February 15, 2024. The communications document ongoing efforts to obtain therapeutic approvals (initial therapy visits and later therapy approval), medical records to support off-work status and TTD benefits, changes in treating providers (Grant Chiropractic to Taylor Co. Chiropractic & Rehabilitation), and the associated administrative actions required by both the insurer and the law firm to move the claim forward.

episodes.natural_language:
Case: Christopher-Wilkerson-WC-MVA-02-15-2024. Client: Christopher Wilkerson. This narrative covers the communications surrounding Christopher Wilkerson’s workers’ compensation matter (Christopher Wilkerson 238042) from spring through late summer 2024, including treatment updates, employment status, and requests for temporary total disability (TTD) benefits.

In the sequence of communications, Debbie Smith at ClearPath Specialty Insurance (now operating under Harford Mutual Insurance Group, with the newer hm1842.com domain) received an update from The Whaley Law Firm on April 5, 2024 noting the domain change and instructing others to update contact lists accordingly. Debbie’s message explained that all ClearPath emails had transitioned to the hm1842.com extension due to the merger with Harford Mutual; recipients were asked to update their contact lists to ensure efficient handling of email correspondence.

On July 24, 2024, Sarena Tuttle of The Whaley Law Firm informed Debbie that Mr. Wilkerson was not satisfied with treatment at Grant Chiropractic. Dr. Grant advised that because Mr. Wilkerson had exhausted his initial 20 visits, the claim had ended. Mr. Wilkerson had scheduled an appointment with Taylor Co. Chiropractic & Rehabilitation on Greenbriar Drive in Campbellsville, KY for July 29, 2024. Sarena noted that the updated Kentucky Department of Workers’ Claims Form 113 for Taylor Co. Chiro was attached to that communication.

By August 12, 2024, Sarena Tuttle reported that Mr. Wilkerson had called earlier that morning to say he had been terminated from his position due to his medical treatment and ongoing appointments. At that time, she reiterated the request for initiation of TTD Benefits and asked Debbie to contact their office if there were questions or issues with the request.

On August 23, 2024 at 2:23 PM, Sarena again wrote to Debbie (with Greg Whaley and Bryce Koon cc’d) that Mr. Wilkerson had contacted them again, this time indicating that his Physical Therapy had not yet been approved. She requested an update on what was needed to obtain PT approval and noted that they were awaiting medical records for his TTD benefits.

That same day, August 23, 2024, Debbie Smith replied at 5:16 PM, stating that she had faxed approval for 12 therapy visits. Debbie asked that The Whaley Law Firm provide updated notes for Mr. Wilkerson’s off-work status so she could review the file for lost time. Debbie’s signature identified her as Senior Claims Examiner for ClearPath Specialty Insurance, with Direct and Main phone numbers listed, and she included the standard confidentiality and external-email notices that accompany such communications. The message also contained the customary reminder to reference the claim number when faxing claim documents and to be aware of the newly updated hm1842.com email addresses.

Later on August 26, 2024 at 9:34 AM, Sarena Tuttle replied to Debbie with a brief, courteous note: “That is awesome. Thank you so much.” This acknowledged the earlier step of PT approval and related documentation.

The latest substantive update came on August 27, 2024. In that message, Sarena Tuttle advised Debbie that Mr. Wilkerson’s last day of work had been August 2, 2024. She attached certified medical records from Taylor Co. Chiro & Rehab, which stated that Mr. Wilkerson’s seated occupation was contributing to limited and delayed progress/response to care. The communication noted that Mr. Wilkerson had been terminated from employment due to missing too many days for treatment, and he was requesting TTD benefits to support his treatment and recovery until he could return to full-time work. Sarena requested an update on the initiation of his TTD benefits and invited Debbie to contact her directly to discuss any further needs.

Contact details for ongoing communications remained with Sarena M. Tuttle, Litigation Paralegal and Workers’ Compensation Case Manager at The Whaley Law Firm, 712 Lyndon Lane, Louisville, KY 40222. Her direct line was (502) 357-9971, and her office line was (502) 583-4022 ext 104, with the email address Sarena@WhaleyLawFirm.com (noting the new address). Debbie Smith’s role as Sr. Claims Examiner for ClearPath Specialty Insurance (now hm1842 domain) continued with Direct: 502-315-4280 and Main: 800-638-3669, and included similar confidentiality notices in correspondence.

In summary, the case details reflect Mr. Wilkerson’s termination from employment on August 2, 2024 due to attendance issues related to his medical treatment, the attachment of Taylor Co. chiropractic records indicating a seated occupation contributing to slow progress, and a request for TTD benefits to support treatment and recovery until he can return to full-time work. There were approvals for 12 therapy visits, requests for updated off-work notes to support lost-time review, and ongoing dialogue between The Whaley Law Firm and ClearPath/Harford Mutual representatives to address PT approval and TTD initiation.

__Details:__ Recvd Call from Client - Client has returned to work & is only treating w/Dr. Grant on Saturdays since is he on the road all week - Client states that Chiro does make things better for a day or so but by the end of the week it is back to just as bad - Advised Client would forward info to BK & AW for further instruction - Discuss exhausting conservative treatment before moving to a Specialist - Client is 8 weeks post Dump Truck Roll Over - Advised Client we may need to get updated imaging requested - Awaiting BK & AW Response

episodes.natural_language:
Initial client contact on April 22, 2024, with Sarena regarding Christopher Wilkerson's motor vehicle accident case, Christopher-Wilkerson-WC-MVA-02-15-2024. The client has returned to work and is only treating with Dr. Grant on Saturdays since he is on the road all week. He reports that chiropractic care helps for a day or so, but by the end of the week his symptoms are back to the same level. The client is eight weeks post dump truck rollover.

I advised that he would forward information to BK & AW for further instruction, and we discussed exhausting conservative treatment before moving to a specialist. We may need to obtain updated imaging, and we are awaiting responses from BK & AW.

Good afternoon Chris,
 This is Sarena with The Whaley Law Firm. We just wanted to update you that we have spoken with Kentucky Farm Bureau & there is a Personal Injury Protection Claim open for your incident. However, before they can issue any decisions or payments they will need to get a statement from you. We have scheduled this statement to take place on Monday, March 11, 2024 at 1pm EST. Please be available for a 15-20 min conversation simply reviewing the incident in your own words. If you have any questions, please do not hesitate to contact us directly to discuss them in further detail.

episodes.natural_language:
The following is a narrative summary of the communications about Christopher Wilkerson’s workers’ compensation claim (238042) arising from the motor vehicle incident dated February 15, 2024 (WC-MVA-02-15-2024). The client is Christopher Wilkerson, with The Whaley Law Firm handling the case and Sarena M. Tuttle, Litigation Paralegal and Workers’ Compensation Case Manager, coordinating the communications with Debbie Smith of ClearPath Specialty Insurance (later noted to be under Harford Mutual Insurance Group).

On August 12, 2024, Sarena Tuttle advised Debbie Smith that she had spoken with Mr. Wilkerson earlier that morning and learned he had been terminated from his position due to medical treatment and ongoing appointments. She reiterated the request to initiate Temporary Total Disability (TTD) benefits and asked Debbie to contact The Whaley Law Firm’s office if there were any questions or issues with the request.

On August 23, 2024, at 2:23 PM, Sarena wrote again to Debbie, reporting that Mr. Wilkerson’s PT had not yet been approved and asking what was needed to obtain PT approval. She also stated that the team was awaiting medical records for his TTD benefits.

Later on August 23, 2024, at 5:16 PM, Debbie Smith replied that she had faxed approval for 12 therapy visits and requested updated notes for the off-work status so she could review the file for lost time.

On August 26, 2024, at 9:34 AM, Sarena responded, “Good morning Debbie, That is awesome. Thank you so much.” indicating appreciation for Debbie’s earlier action.

On August 27, 2024, at 1:29 PM, Sarena provided a more substantive update: Mr. Wilkerson’s last day working was August 2, 2024. She attached certified medical records from Taylor Co. Chiropractic & Rehab, which indicate that the seated occupation is causing limited or delayed progress/response to care. She noted that Mr. Wilkerson had been terminated from employment due to missing too many days for treatment, and, at this time, would like to receive TTD benefits to aid his treatment and recovery until he is able to return to full-time work. She requested an update on the initiation of his TTD benefits and asked Debbie to let them know if anything else was needed.

On October 8, 2024, at 1:56 PM (13:56:46 in the timestamp), Sarena stated that she and Mr. Wilkerson had recently spoken with his treating physician. They were updated that Mr. Wilkerson had been given the opportunity to see how his injuries would fare under normal working conditions, but his condition had not improved and he had returned to treatment. The Whaley Law Firm and the provider would continue to pursue treatment intended to reduce his pain while working and to achieve maximum medical improvement. In the meantime, Sarena requested a copy of any and all documents used to calculate his average weekly wages for this incident.

Throughout the correspondence, the emails also reflect that Debbie Smith’s contact information and corporate domain changed in connection with a merger: following ClearPath’s merger with Harford Mutual Insurance Group, all ClearPath Mutual email addresses were updated to the hm1842.com domain. Debbie Smith’s signature blocks and references to the ClearPath/Sr. Claims Examiner role include the new domain, and a separate note dated April 5, 2024 reminded recipients to update their contact lists to reflect the new harford mutual email extension. The communications also included the Whaley Law Firm’s standard contact details for Sarena Tuttle (The Whaley Law Firm, 712 Lyndon Lane, Louisville, KY 40222; D: 502-357-9971; O: 502-583-4022 ext 104; E: Sarena@WhaleyLawFirm.com, with the reminder to note the new email address).

Case: Christopher-Wilkerson-WC-MVA-02-15-2024. Client: Christopher Wilkerson.

In October 2024, the Whaley Law Firm sent a forward of communications regarding Mr. Wilkerson’s workers’ compensation matter, titled “Fwd: Christopher Wilkerson 238042.” The message, dated October 8, 2024, was from Sarena Tuttle, a litigation paralegal and workers’ compensation case manager at The Whaley Law Firm, to Mrs. Woods, with CCs to Bryce Koon and others. It requested treatment updates and “any and all documents related to Mr. Wilkerson’s average weekly wages,” noting that Mrs. Smith would be out of the office for the remainder of the week but that the documents were needed as soon as possible. The email signature identified Sarena M. Tuttle and included her contact information and a notification to note the new email address.

The forwarded thread contains a subsequent message from Sarena Tuttle, dated October 8, 2024 at 1:56 PM, addressed to Debbie Smith with CCs to Greg Whaley and Bryce Koon. In this message, they reported having spoken with Mr. Wilkerson and his treating physician. They updated that Mr. Wilkerson had been given the opportunity to see how his injuries would respond under normal working conditions, but his condition has not improved and he has returned to treatment. The team stated they were working with his provider to ensure he receives the necessary treatment to reduce pain while working and to move toward a maximum medical improvement (MMI) standpoint. They also requested a copy of any and all documents used to calculate his average weekly wages for the incident.

This October thread followed earlier communications from August 2024. On August 27, 2024 at 1:29 PM, Sarena Tuttle wrote to Debbie Smith (with CCs to Greg Whaley and Bryce Koon) that Mr. Wilkerson’s last day of work was August 2, 2024. She attached certified medical records from Taylor Co. Chiropractic & Rehabilitation, which indicated that Mr. Wilkerson’s seated occupation was causing limited or delayed progress/response to care. The message stated that Mr. Wilkerson had been terminated from employment due to missing too many days for treatment and that, at this time, he would like to receive temporary total disability (TTD) benefits to assist with treatment and recovery until he could return to full-time work. They asked Debbie Smith to update them on whether TTD initiation had begun and to contact them if anything else was needed to discuss the matter.

The August 27 message was preceded by an August 26, 2024 note in which Sarena Tuttle replied, “Good morning Debbie, That is awesome. Thank you so much,” expressing thanks.

Earlier, on August 23, 2024 at 5:16 PM, Debbie Smith replied that she had faxed approval for 12 therapy visits and requested updated notes for the off-work status so she could review the file for lost time. The reply included standard confidentiality and contact disclaimers and references to claiming documents going by fax to 410-420-3002 with the instruction to reference the claim number. Debbie Smith identified her role as Sr. Claims Examiner at Clearpath Specialty Insurance, with direct and main contact numbers provided.

Also on August 23, 2024 at 2:23 PM, Sarena Tuttle sent another message (labeled as external in the chain) to Debbie Smith, noting that Mr. Wilkerson had reached out again, indicating that his physical therapy had not yet been approved. They requested clarification on what was needed to get his PT approved and stated they were awaiting medical records for his TTD benefits at that time.

The chronology also includes an August 12, 2024 message from Sarena Tuttle at 1:38 PM to Debbie Smith. In this message, they reported receiving a call from Mr. Wilkerson stating that he had been terminated from his position due to his medical treatment and continued appointments. They again requested initiation of his TTD benefits and invited further discussion if there were questions or issues.

Additionally, on July 24, 2024, at 12:06 PM, Sarena Tuttle wrote to Debbie Smith (and CC’d Greg Whaley and Bryce Koon) reporting that Mr. Wilkerson was unhappy with the treatment at Grant Chiropractic. Dr. Grant had advised that because Mr. Wilkerson had exhausted his initial 20 visits, the claim had ended. Mr. Wilkerson had scheduled an appointment with Taylor Co. Chiropractic & Rehabilitation on Greenbriar Drive in Campbellsville, KY for July 29, 2024. The email included attachment of the updated Kentucky Division of Workers’ Compensation Form 113 for Taylor Co. Chiro and invited any questions.

In summary, between July and October 2024, Mr. Wilkerson’s case involved: termination from employment on account of medical treatment and attendance, initiation and pursuit of TTD benefits, scheduling and switching between chiropractors (Grant Chiropractic to Taylor Co. Chiropractic & Rehabilitation), approval and scheduling of therapy visits (12 therapy visits approved), ongoing requests for documentation to calculate average weekly wages, updates on treatment status and progress toward maximum medical improvement, and repeated requests for medical records to support disability and wage calculations. The communications were exchanged primarily between The Whaley Law Firm (Sarena Tuttle, including contact details and the note about a new email address) and Debbie Smith at Clearpath Specialty Insurance, with CCs to Greg Whaley and Bryce Koon. The claim number referenced in the correspondence is 238042. The firm’s address is 712 Lyndon Lane, Louisville, KY 40222, with the Whaley Law Firm’s direct and office lines, and Sarena’s email address was noted as Sarena@WhaleyLawFirm.com.

Re: Christopher Wilkerson 238042. The following narrative summarizes the email communications between The Whaley Law Firm and Harford Mutual Insurance Group regarding Christopher Wilkerson’s workers’ compensation claim.

On October 10, 2024, at 10:07 a.m. Eastern Time, Sarena M. Tuttle, a litigation paralegal and workers’ compensation case manager at The Whaley Law Firm, sent an email to Kristi Woods of Harford Mutual Insurance Group. In the message, which also included Bryce Koon on CC and Debbie Smith on CC, Sarena thanked Kristi for the quick response earlier that morning. She stated that, while she understood Harford’s position on temporary total disability (TTD) benefits, The Whaley Law Firm was requesting the documents related to the calculations of Mr. Wilkerson’s average weekly wages (AWW). She clarified that they were not asking Harford to initiate TTD at that time; that would be addressed with Mrs. Smith separately. Regardless of the status of TTD, Sarena asserted that the law firm was entitled to a copy of the documents used to calculate the AWW benefits, noting that this request had been made since the initiation of the claim and the documents had not yet been received. The message closed with Sarena’s professional signature, which included her title, the firm’s address at 712 Lyndon Lane, Louisville, KY 40222, direct and office phone numbers, and her email address Sarena@WhaleyLawFirm.com, with a parenthetical note stating “PLEASE NOTE NEW EMAIL ADDRESS.”

In the same thread, Kristi Woods replied on October 10, 2024, at approximately 10:02 a.m. (the record shows “10:02?AM,” indicating an uncertain timestamp). Her response referenced Debbie’s prior file notes on Mr. Wilkerson’s claim dated August 13, 2024. Kristi indicated that Debbie had approved physical therapy (PT X12) and that Debbie was waiting on Mr. Wilkerson’s medical records to review any mention of TTD or medical status. Kristi stated that once those medical records were received, Harford would have a clearer idea of how to proceed. Earlier in the thread, Sarena had forwarded a message from herself to Kristi Woods on October 10, 2024, at 9:39 a.m. In that forwarded note, Sarena requested “our treatment update & request for any and all documents related to Mr. Wilkerson’s average weekly wages.” She noted that Mrs. Smith would be out of the office for the remainder of that week but stressed the need to obtain the documents as soon as possible. Sarena also asked Kristi to inform Mrs. Smith that Kristi’s auto-reply email address was incorrect. The forward included Sarena’s full signature details and Kristi Woods’ contact information again, along with a reminder that replies to the email would be saved in the records.

The messages also contained standard confidentiality and organizational notices typical of the correspondence, including Harford Mutual’s confidentiality language and disclosures intended to restrict access to the information to the named recipients. The thread consistently referenced the case and claim number (Christopher Wilkerson 238042) and noted the ongoing needs surrounding Mr. Wilkerson’s AWW calculations, medical records, and the status of potential TTD discussions.
